content.description: Fun way to top out on the face, the arete is pretty straight forward and the top out is easy.Bring multiple pads to protect the boulders, mainly left of the start.
content.protection: Crash pad, falling from the top on only one crash pad would hurt because of two boulders right and left of the start. If you can bring a friend or a couple pads.
content.location: East face, start is low and uses a small shelf and pocket.Â

content.description: Shark Fin is a proud 15 foot tall boulder with 3 obvious routes on it. It is Welded Tuff with really cool pockets and cracks. The east face is slightly steep with a blank face with one clean obvious line, and a second arrete route. The north side is sharper and shorter. Will be updated as projects are done on this really cool boulder.
